newsitem.title: USA: NHL-AVALANCHE COACH MARC CRAWFORD FINED $10,000.
newsitem.headline: NHL-AVALANCHE COACH MARC CRAWFORD FINED $10,000.

text.p: Colorado Avalanche coach Marc Crawford completely lost his temper Thursday night in Game 4 of the Western Conference finals, and it will cost him $10,000, the National Hockey League announced on Friday.
Crawford was fined for conduct "dishonorable, prejudicial to or against the welfare of the league," the NHL said.
Crawford's explosion occurred in the fight-filled third period of Colorado's 6-0 loss to the Detroit Red Wings. The defending Stanley Cup champion Avalanche trail the best-of-seven series, 3-1.
Following one melee, Crawford and Detroit coach Scotty Bowman exchanged heated words across the glass partition that separates the players' benches.

"As a result of Colorado Avalanche coach Marc Crawford's actions at the 17:42 mark of the third period when he had to be physically restrained from entering the Detroit players' bench, a fine of $10,000 was assessed today by the National Hockey League,"

"Obviously, emotions got out of whack," Crawford explained after the game. "You say some stupid things, they say some stupid things. It happens. It happened to us earlier in the playoffs. Nobody's proud of it, but it's part of the game."
Even Bowman, the coach with the most wins in NHL history, appeared surprised by the emotional nature of Crawford's attack.
"He was pretty emotional," Bowman said. "I guess I've been that way before, too. But his eyes were coming out of his head. He was pretty excited."
NHL Senior Vice President Brian Burke said: "Although Mr Crawford has since apologised to the league for his behaviour, this does not excuse the fact that his actions were totally inappropriate."
